Comment:
Maybe the best move in the opening.I am not sure.
However the most played one.And the Philidor Defence that i couldnt understand its purpose start.
A symetrical answer to share center fairly.
Develops the knight and attacks the pawn.
Saves the pawn but no development. I think Nc6 is better.(Nf6 is good,too)
Develops the bishop and controls the diogonal.
f5?! He thinks i will capture the pawn and have a free space for bishop but i won't.
Saves e5 pawn and lets queen's bishop a free diogonal.
Pins my knight so i cannot play it.And the bishop comes to a good square.
Now, a small trap -that remember how piece development is important at the opening- starts.
Not a good move.He tries not to let me attack his queen by Bg5 but he loses tempo and forgets development.
Capture Queen or knight? Which one seems logical?
Yeah.He couldnt see the danger and captured my queen.
King has only one square to go.
A nice mate with coordination of knights and bishop.
